title: 110_hr1331
content: Credit for new qualified plug-in hybrid motor vehicles is provided in Section 1. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to specify the credit amount for new qualified hybrid motor vehicles with a gross vehicle weight rating of not more than 8,500 pounds. The credit amount is determined based on fuel economy and other factors. The credit amount for new qualified plug-in hybrid motor vehicles is determined based on fuel economy and conservation credit. The credit amount for new qualified plug-in hybrid motor vehicles is determined based on fuel economy and conservation credit. For vehicles with a gross vehicle weight rating of not more than 8,500 pounds, the amount is the sum of base amount of $3,000 and additional amounts for flexible fuel capability. The credit amount for new qualified plug-in hybrid motor vehicles is determined based on fuel economy and conservation credit. For vehicles with a traction battery of not less than 5 kWh, the amount is $500, plus $250 for each kWh exceeding 5 kWh, not to exceed $3,000. The amendment to section 30B of the Code defines a new qualified plug-in hybrid motor vehicle as meeting emission standards, having a traction battery of at least 4 kWh, and the ability to recharge from an external source of electricity. The amendment to section 30B of the Code introduces a limitation on the number of new qualified plug-in hybrid motor vehicles eligible for credit. This includes treating only new qualified plug-in hybrid vehicles as qualified, adjusting the limit to 100,000 vehicles, and changing the effective date to the enactment of the amendment. The amendment to section 30B(f) of the Code limits the eligibility for credit to new qualified plug-in hybrid motor vehicles, with an adjusted limit of 100,000 vehicles. The effective date for these amendments is after the enactment of the Act.
